problem_text:
Does every group G = ⟨x1, . . . , xn | r1 = · · · = rm = 1⟩ possess, in a natural way, a homomorphic image H = ⟨x1, . . . , xn | s1 = · · · = sm = 1⟩
(a) such that H is a torsion-free group?
(b) such that the integral group ring of H is embeddable in a skew field?
If the stronger assertion “b” is true, then this will give an explicit method of finding elements xi1, . . . , xin−m which generate a free group in G. Such elements exist by N. S. Romanovski˘ı’s theorem (Algebra and Logic, 16, no. 1 (1977), 62–67).
V. A. Roman’kov
